column4: wow,  listening to ubuntuedgy it is almost as if  xp never experiences random shutdown or kernel errors,
nope we worked on a dual boot problem with grub though
but I got it going with disk boot options in my bios
k,  I wanted to show that guy someting but I don'T recall his nick
just installed fiesty on a laptop, need to get wireless NIC running... need a starting point at least
been researching madwifi and ndiswrapper but I got lost !
ndiswrapper is only needed if you have to use the window driver
ask a specific question ,  what do you need to do at this point
I'm using the atheros drivers (install did that)  it shows i'm fine but I can't seem to find my router
if no one here can help , try searching in the forum
nobody has tried to help.  If it were windows i'd tell someone to do me a quick ipconfig /all to see what devices are installed...what do do in linux as an equivelant?
ifconfig is the linux equivalent of ipconfig
ok, all looks good i guess.  I have ath0.. lo..  and wifi0 reports Link encap: UNSPEC  should this be like that?
no idea, I donT have a wifi , I just have a lame dsl without a router
SWEET!  I knew I was close... On the Net baby!  I just didnt have my DHCP enabled
